Award.AwardTitle: Funding to Support Student Attendees to Programming Language Design and Implementation (PLDI) 2010 Conference

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

Award.AbstractNarration: This travel grant requests funds to support graduate student travel to the Symposium on Programming Language Design and Implementation (PLDI). This is a top conference in Computer Science for research and education in the core areas of Software and Hardware Foundations program. The funds enables students to hear the latest results in the field, meet established researchers, and build community with the next generation of researchers.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This grant enabled 12 students to attend one of the top conferences in the area of programming languages: ACM Conference on Programming Language Design and Implementation.  Attending such conferences is vital to the development and training of researchers and educators.

 

The following is the list of students given the awards along with the amount of the award, their gender, and their intitution.  

Mason Chang $750.00 6/22/2010 $750.00
5/11/2010 University of California, Irvine
Brian Burg $422.00 6/22/2010 $525.00
4/27/2010 male Purdue University/University of 
Washington
Jennifer Sartor $1,378.00 6/22/2010
$1,378.00 4/21/2010 female University of Texas, 
Austin
Thomas Austin $1,220.00 6/22/2010
$1,220.00 5/6/2010 male University of 
California, Santa Clara
Pamela Bhattacharya $1,051.97 6/29/2010
$1,070.00 5/3/2010 female University of 
california, Riverside
Christopher Hill $250.00 7/8/2010
$250.00 5/11/2010 male University of Rochester
Gregory Malecha $907.00 7/8/2010 $907.00
4/27/2010 male Harvard University
Qian Xi $1,170.00 7/8/2010 $1,170.00
5/6/2010 female Princeton University
Anh Vo $1,310.00 7/16/2010 $1,310.00
4/21/2010 male University of Utah
Mark Reitblatt $1,150.00 7/16/2010
$1,150.00 5/10/2010 male University of Texas, 
Austin/Cornell University
Daniel Bartkowski $250.00 7/16/2010
$250.00 5/11/2010 male University of Rochester
Ravi Chugh $640.00 $640.00 5/3/2010
University of California, San Diego

ACM administered these awards based on need and merit, considering factors such as whether or not the student application was presenting at the conference.
